title: Odohu
author: Odohu
content: My fellow country people, it took me time to gather the courage to post this here and my motive is to encourage us to help in our own little ways in creating awareness and support... just maybe we can fight this without waiting for government alone. Anytime them mentioned out of school children, people mind dey easily go to Northern Nigeria but e go shock you to know say the reality for Southern Nigeria dey troubling as out of school children is a threat in Southern Nigeria as much as it is in Northern Nigeria.According to UNESCO report of 2022, over 20 million Nigerian children are out of school. But from my findings and recent happenings, the number is far more than this. UNESCO will use poverty, insecurity and other parameters to do their statistics. Unfortunately, their is a new trend that is taking children, especially those between the ages of 14 to 18,  out of school which no one is paying attention to.  This is call quest for money and easy life. We all are aware of the Word " education is a scam". Indeed, this word is eating deep into our youths and the reality of our country is substantiating their claim. I did a random sampling in Port Harcourt few weeks ago, I was shocked to see the number of young boys including girls who willingly stopped going to school and decided to focus on learning how to "press", socialize and blend. The thing be say, depending on your approach, they are not hiding it... they willingly give you the info with pride. This G-boys something and runs now make education look like a long distance quest. How did we get here? Who is to blame for this? What will be the future of our country where education is not a priority? How do we tackle this because where there is a disconnect in learning something good for humanity,  the knowledge for the wrong will surely increase and this will put all of us at risk. Make we reason on ways we can help as we cannot leave everything for government.NB: I don search this board for this kind of topic but I no see any. In case person been don post am, abeg make una pardon me and draw my attention to it.

comments.author: Adbitco
comments.body: There's more to what's happening now because of the current trends nowadays, people hardly devote time to look into school why because they want an easy life without waiting for their appointed time to come. Just like I said, laziness has eaten us up because we think and thought school is a waste of time well there's no way school is waste of time because education plays a vital and a viral role in our lives today but thoss who doesn't have that dream of making it through education can never believe something good could come out from education due to our educational sector today.Why because it's anathema to see our educational system today were a student would graduate without at least having to sorts their course this a lone has destroyed and discouraged most of them not to put effort in reading, whereby they felt after all every they would still end up having to sort those courses in other to make the required grade the wanted. This is not common with the white because I believe they had a solid foundation for education and it can never be compromised just as our system and aside from that our government never placed value on her citizens this is another major weak points that is gradually sinking us down, if they play their roles and places value to their students possible adopted the educational system of the foreigners I believe no one would called school to be scam because they will be working as well earning and I don't think any one of us would had this mentality to leave our country to another country in search of a greener pastures.While we had a better country, a better society and a better Nation where things are made possible for us but those who felt they are the owners of our nation held us captive and that is not even enough, they kept circulating power among themselves if at all this nation were set to be a nation governed and ruled by gerontocracy where no one breaths or even haven to speak their minds and they always believed what they said is the best. How do we grow and how would her youths have this energetic power to develop love and passion for education since their leaders has already compromised the entire system?

The thing be say, depending on your approach, they are not hiding it... they willingly give you the info with pride. This G-boys something and runs now make education look like a long distance quest. In a case of someone dropping out of school due to no finance or no assess to a good school then I would be concern and would support this movement, but a case of a student who decided to drop out of school because they have other interests then I think their decision and what ever outcome they get from that it's entirely theirs.We all know that the government has failed up but this statement won't stand in anyone's favor when they are being arranged for any crime, I think the society and social media has glorified the wrong things infact the is becoming the high cause of drop out than finances, because there are now so much free or low fees schools but the search to attain that status that has been so glorified has caused many to chase the wrong things

comments.author: Odohu
comments.body: Quote from: Adbitco on July 23, 2023, 05:16:08 PMHow do we grow and how would her youths have this energetic power to develop love and passion for education since their leaders has already compromised the entire system?I think this is the most important factor discouraging people from going to school... the leaders have bastardized the system. When you look at the lives and achievement of those who are graduate in Nigeria, you will be so discouraged because majority of the graduates succeeded from their personal effort not that the system made it possible that when you graduate, there is a place for you. On the other hand, many employed graduates are under employed and this practically make them live from hand to mouth. So, the younger once seeing this would rather opt for other options rather than aspire to be like their educated brothers wey nothin come out. But in all, education is not really that bad as it forms the foundation upon which every other thing is built. We should still encourage our brothers and systems to at least get the basic education before venturing into any other thing they consider interesting to them.

comments.author: EluguHcman
comments.body: Point of contacts in learning or acquiring skills and ideas would either boost your ventures or weakens your ventures.Surroundings is indeed ineffective to lives where if you must succeed then you must surround yourself with those on the same missions as you just as my 1st topic in this forum could entail @ https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5458884.msg62512588#msg62512588 .The government are to be blamed because these youths looked forth some educated relatives ending up adapting to a different carrier differing from their field of educational studies and the hard lives they experiences.E.g.  Someone Graduated as a professional Journalist ends up being a Carpenter.Foremost when if you graduates from school and obtains your degrees you have chances of protecting a job but at now even if you graduates and obtains a PhD you stands to go into the labor markets, struggles for a favour and if it doesn't work out good, it is either you obtain a skill or you find yourself one way or the other to keep life goingEducation would remain a priority to the youths but the government doesn't give it that credit and medium of explorations.Majority of educated people are left jobless otherwise, majority left their educational carriers and adapt to different fields of life.The government owes education an encouragement else the youths would keep loosing faiths in the educational systems.My advice to the youths >>> Emulate what is right and don't lost focus for education remains the key to humans desires explorations.If the changes of the system doesn't profit you good then you have to change the system.

comments.author: Doan9269
comments.body: We cannot pretend to be suffering and smiling when things are not going well in disguise for being alright, people are suffering and most of those affected were the children who cannot think and plan for themselves for a better life, before I drop my own opinion i must applaud some charity homecares that has taken the responsibility of the welfare of vulnerable children on the streets in taking good care of them, there are philanthropist as well i this regards also contributing to see this children get to school and out of the streetGovernment also have many vital roles to play in this by supporting with the necessary help needed to see that vulnerable street children have access to proper education and leave under their care and welfare provisions, if we don't take care of this children today, they will constitute the nuisance that will disturb the society tomorrow, because they are the leader of tomorrow and we must take their responsibility our utmost priority.
